title: Newtons laws - tension in a heavy hanging rope

content.question: A block with a weight of <math alttext="50 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math> hangs vertically by a rope, with uniform density, attached to a hook as shown. The weight of the rope is <math alttext="5 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math>. Which statement best describes the tension in the rope?

choices.label: The tension in the rope is <math alttext="50 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math> at every location along the rope.
The tension in the rope is <math alttext="55 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>55</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math> at every location the rope.

The tension in the rope changes uniformly from <math alttext="50 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math> at the top of the rope to <math alttext="55 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>55</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math> at the bottom of the rope.

The tension in the rope changes uniformly from <math alttext="50 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math> at the bottom of the rope to <math alttext="55 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>55</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math> at the top of the rope.

content.answer: The tension in the rope changes uniformly from <math alttext="50 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math> at the bottom of the rope to <math alttext="55 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>55</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math> at the top of the rope.
